p: Developed by Mullis and Faloona (1987), nucleic acid amplification by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) has revolutionized the field of molecular diagnosis. The basic PCR assay relies on extraction and purification of the nucleic acid, then exponential amplification of the target sequence, using a thermostable polymerase enzyme and specific primers. The resulting amplicons are then identified using a fluorescence-based detection system, and the result is reported in international units IU/ml.
